title: Brake Fluid Level Inspection

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
In accordance with the Scheduled Maintenance chart, inspect the brake fluid level in the front and rear master cylinder reservoirs.
Front Brake Fluid level D34; D71; D74; DD2; DD4; DE2; DEX; DF2; DF4; DG4; DR4; DS1; DS4; DSA; DSB; DSX; DVY
The brake fluid level must be kept between the upper and lower level lines with the motorcycle on its side stand and the steering on full left lock.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: D34; DD4; D74; DR4; DS4; D71; DG4; DF4; DVY; DEX; DSB; DSA; DD2; DSX; DS1; DF2; DE2

body.body: Front brake fluid level adjustment D71; D74; DD2; DE2; DEX; DF2; DF4; DG4; DR4; DS1; DS4; DSA; DSB; DSX; DVY
Remove the reservoir cap and the diaphragm seal.
Fill the reservoir to the upper level line using new DOT 4 fluid from a sealed container.
Refit the reservoir cap and diaphragm seal ensuring that the diaphragm seal is correctly positioned between the cap and the reservoir body.
Refit the two fixings and tighten to

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: D74; DR4; DS4; D71; DG4; DF4; DVY; DEX; DSB; DSA; DD2; DSX; DS1; DF2; DE2

body.body: Rear brake fluid reservoir D34; DD2; DD4; DEX; DF4; DG4
Remove the right hand side panel (see
The brake fluid level must be kept between the upper and lower level lines (reservoir held horizontal).

body.name: Rear Brake Res Levels (side panel connectors dd2_1)

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: D34; DD4; DG4; DF4; DD2; DEX

body.body: Rear brake fluid reservoir adjustment DD2; DD4; DEX; DF4; DG4
Remove and discard the fixing and detach the rear brake fluid reservoir from the relay bracket.

body.name: Rear Brake Res (side panel connectors DD2)

body.body: Release the cap screws and remove the reservoir cover noting the position of the sealing diaphragm.
Fill the reservoir to the upper level line using new DOT 4 fluid from a sealed container.
Refit the reservoir cap ensuring that the diaphragm seal is correctly positioned between the cap and the reservoir body. Tighten the cap retaining screws to
Refit the brake fluid reservoir to the relay bracket, and tighten the new fixing to
